newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan central banker vows "appropriate" reactions.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan central banker vows "appropriate" reactions.

text.p: Taiwan central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong vowed on Monday to react appropriately in the face of any market-shaking contingency, adjusting liquidity levels as necessary.

"Please believe that the government has the power to deal with any fluctuations," Sheu told reporters when asked about major market-moving factors such as Taiwan's pork crisis and unconfirmed reports of war games to be mounted by rival China.
Analysts said those two factors sent the hypersensitive stock market tumbling 6.4 percent since Friday.

"All nationals should have gotten used to this," Sheu said of China's military manoeuvres, which shook the island during 1995 and 1996 in what the communist government in Beijing said was a warning against pursuing independence for Taiwan.
"The central bank will react appropriately, and when necessary will inject funds" into the market, Sheu said.
